snippet: President Obama’s tour of New Jersey with Gov. Chris Christie confronted Mitt Romney with a vexing challenge just as he returned to the campaign trail in Florida.
abstract: Pres Obama and New Jersey Gov Chris Christie put aside politics and tour state's storm-ravaged coastline together in vivid display of big-government muscle and bipartisan harmony; prominent coverage of unlikely political pair confronts Mitt Romney with vexing challenge as he returns to campaign trail in Florida, one week before Election Day.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and MICHAEL BARBARO
byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Washington, and Michael Barbaro reported from Coral Gables, Fla. Michael D. Shear contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: President Obama’s tour of New Jersey with Gov. Chris Christie confronted Mitt Romney with a vexing challenge just as he returned to the campaign trail in Florida.

headline.seo: Obama Tours Storm-Ravaged New Jersey With Gov. Chris Christie
headline.main: An Unlikely Political Pair, United by a Disaster
headline.print_headline: An Unlikely Political Pair, United by a Disaster
